The .onion Hidden WIkis that used to host links to that stuff have been scrubbed of any CP related info.

>>37867fa9-e661-4e87-937c-8239652f2266
You don't want to update the site's javascript files with some stranger's files, yet you trust the site owner to provide you with that same code? Do you know him personally or something?
You need to convert it to mp4. If the file takes more than 10 seconds to process then it's an unsupported extension.

>>4a217470-700c-422d-81c6-a375c04eb8aa
>Damn. I found a proxy site that lets me see what a user with a 08chan certificate sees.
What do you mean? It's not about what certificate the users have. It's about what's already stored on disk in the user's directory.
I presume your Zeronet install shows old posts. If you want to see what a new users sees then just close your Zeronet server, install a new Zeronet to another folder, launch it and access the site.
Anyway, I'm going to sleep. Tomorrow or Sunday I might go over the ZeroFrame API and see if I find any way of whitelisting.
You might want to try to contact the ZeroNet devs and ask them about the whitelisting thing. Maybe they have an IRC or something. This is the largest zite ever after all.
Also lets way for the guy who mentioned "adding a backdoor" to see what he meant. He seems to know about this stuff.

>>589d0f4c-b0d1-4ab0-a724-74dfe92bc3eb
STFU boomer
test
test
test

>>26e9acff-6aad-401f-9dc9-f95a54d50912
test

>>26e9acff-6aad-401f-9dc9-f95a54d50912
Well, whatever you did, it's not working (I just saw a post where you said you set the content.json as a downloadable, where did that post go?).
Edit: if you did indeed do that, then it probably just means that users are allowed to upload .json files. But when they are stored on disk, they'll be stored with their hash as a filename, so they won't be stored as an actually valid .json. Unless there's a field to specify that they'll be stored by name and not by hash.
And in any case, they won't be sent in the first place, because the clients will reject them because they don't come from a client with a valid certificate (kind of a catch-22 situation there).

>>26e9acff-6aad-401f-9dc9-f95a54d50912
>I need to find a way to enable only ZeroID certs for posting, but allow anyone to READ content that was posted with 08chan certs.
That's impossible. They're homomorphic. Whenever a client fetches new data from another user, it doesn't know whether that data came from a relay or from the person who posted it.

>>26e9acff-6aad-401f-9dc9-f95a54d50912
>Assume we start with a fresh Zeronet install
>You have to get a ZeroID
>When you load the site the first time, it loads all posts and content that have a valid cert
>Since the site only accepts ZeroID certs, only content posted with a ZeroID cert is downloaded and saved
>So the site looks empty
Yes, that's what's happening.
>As the local machine, all content was showing up no matter which cert I was using. 
Exactly. Once it is on disk, it's displayed regardless of valid cert or not.
>I also tried to fix and update the announcements
== You probably need to re-post anything you want newfags to read with a valid ZeroID account. ==
I don't think editing will do btw.
>There is some way to manipulate the master /users/content.json file to make this work, I'm sure of it. I just need to figure out the right commands and syntax.
I don't know about that.

>>056d239a-614e-427a-9638-aadb7a96d469
The problem I see with your idea is that there aren't "old 08chan certs" in the sense of "certificates generated by 08chan" (in the sense they're generated by ZeroID). All the old IDs were generated with public/private key pairs randomly generated by the users themselves.
So even if you set up a (centralized) service to sign people's IDs as valid for posting (which is basically what ZeroID does) then that system won't have anything to do with the old self-signed certs, and those will keep being invalid. Because now the certs would be signed by you, and before they were signed by the users themselves.

>>1a78376a-f5d8-43fb-bb6b-ad3686c2ce75
>Edit: Also as soon as you see this go make a copy of your 1DdPH.../data/users/content.json file and hang onto it. I might need to see some of its text when I analyze changes. Right now I need to get to bed.
Huh? You pushed some other change right now? Come on man, you can't change shit and then go to sleep without verifying the site isn't utterly broken!

>>2714cb26-9cc4-440a-ba97-9044c1ceebad
Holy shit, you did indeed fix it. Now let's hope that change doesn't introduce vulnerabilities.
My previous analysis was wrong probably because the files are hashed by the js frontend, but when they are in storage already they're copied as-is. But I don't understand why they are being accepted by other machines without a valid ZeroID certificate. Maybe ZeroNet is smart enough to know if the file to be copied '''is''' the content.json, then it can read the same content.json to determine permissions, possibly before it even exists locally?
This probably opens up a vulnerability, though. Anyone should be able to generate self-signed IDs, put them there on the disk, and other anons will fetch them from him. I don't understand why straight up posting without ZeroID doesn't work. Maybe it goes through another separate mechanism that still performs permission checking. Or maybe your changes didn't propagate enough for me to post without ZID.

>>e4b8057f-88fb-4131-a3ca-89033a0857c9
>Is it a good idea to make some kind of global sticky that has .zip archives (by date?...every so many days?) so newfags can get up to speed on the entire sites content without having to wait for enough peers to even fill it all in?
That's actually a great idea 
We just need someone with a complete-ish folder to upload it all.

>>34c79bec-2ba5-45d5-a7ec-6fa76a738dd3
Yes, that one or 1DdP.../data/users (it's about the same thing really).

>>8b45b0d3-8eaa-45a2-916f-20ab8e46f039
Yes, go into ZeroNet's FAQ and look up how to set up ZeroNet with an external Tor instance. It involves pasting two lines into your zeronet.conf. You'll need to have your Tor Browser running at all times for the fix to work, and you'll need to set it to connect through one of the built in obfs4 bridges.

Guys, the "fix" was a fluke.
== It does absolutely nothing. ==
The reason it seemed to work is that the BO had enabled self-signed certs for a few minutes, and although he thought by the time we reported success it had been disabled, it took a while to propagate, so it seemed like the fix he tried afterwards worked when in fact it does not.
You can go and spin up a fresh ZeroNet instance and check for yourself. Only new threads are displayed.
'''We're back at square one.'''

== Here is one thing we can do, though ==
Posts that are posted with a machine that has the clock set wrong, will appear at the moment the clock of the machine is actually at when they're posted. I accidentally sent posts into the future before by having my clock set up to the wrong timezone. I think in this way we can also send posts back.
If this is the case, then the posts can be re-posted with a single ZeroID. Then the BO can delete the original files as the replacement ones are seeded.
There are two disadvantages with this
- Everything needs to be seeded from scratch
- Pressing mute on any of these posts will remove all of them
But at least it's simple, and it works. **(At least in theory.)**

>>f90285dd-a540-472f-866b-37206cbb74e2
It's an opt-out feature, and you have to manually enable it on every thread, and I'm pretty sure it resets by itself anyways.

>>346cd903-c3f6-44ee-a826-f98639e1b4a7
Yeah, as I said, the two things that are fairly clearly "porn" were blacklisted by the BO. One was a gif of a teen (not sure if underage) getting cum in her face and the other one was a 12ish child rubbing her cunt.
>Surely ass shots don't count as porn
You go tell the judge that.
>Nobody really knows who started what post.
You can know you were the first if no other peer has the file at the moment you receive it. **Yes, it would require a server farm.** You can get some false positives but you can filter them by successive iterations. The more an IP comes up associated with an ID, the more likely it is both belong to the same person.

>>c8dbed68-5c2a-4c40-a49d-bd5ac34edf4b
Not him, but instead of
[code]
"112zDYPuUsAoauhhMakYqcfvYjf4U8dKit": { "max_size": 5000000 },
[/code]
the right format might be
[code]
"xxxxxxxxxxxx@08chan": { "max_size": 5000000 },
[/code]
You can get the xxxxxx@08chan from the content.json of each user, it's the cert_user_id
I'll do some tests later to see if that helps retrieving old posts
And maybe you could not include the
[code]
"cert_signers": {
"08chan": ["1NwwLdiFBcVAA4jXQ712ZtQfDHEMvk8BiD"],
[/code]
and not have to put the 
 ".*@08chan": false
at the end.
Edit: nevermind, tried it and this second way doesn't work, it doesn't anything different from the pre-existing content.json.
